Now the positional clamp  […c6e5] springs my knight to the dominant e5 square, eyeing c4 and f3 while supporting …d5-d4 or other central breaks.  
At the same time the knight shuts out White’s dark-squared bishop.

rounds.response:
I see the knight on c6 has no route to e5 because e5 is blocked by the pawn on e4.  
The same knight can still reach the ideal square, however, by first kicking White’s pawn out of the way.  
Therefore I open the diagonal and free my knight’s path with the powerful advance …d5-d4, which gains space and creates a chronic bind against White’s crumbling center.

[d5d4]
